attributes.action: STOP FREE Dental care an prescriptions for those on Benifits
attributes.additional_details:
Assist those who work an contribute to Tax & NI, I work full time and I am unable to have dental work for a cracked tooth as I don't earn enough to pay for home, bills, children as well as find £300 to have dental work. In addition we have to pay more than £40 per month for medication. Which if I was on Benifits would be FREE.

If I was on Benifits I would received dental care & prescriptions FREE but because I work I'm not entitled to help.

The system is broken it needs reform.
attributes.background:
STOP GIVING FREE DENTAL CARE & PRESCRIPTIINS TO THOSE WHO DON'T WORK OR CONTRIBUTE TO SYSTEM.

HELP THISE WHO CONTRIBUTE AND WORK.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. some people who are entitled to free dental care are in work, or are unable to work, so we're not sure exactly what changes you'd like to see. 

You can find out more about who is entitled to free dental care here:

https://www.nhs.uk/common-health-questions/dental-health/who-is-entitled-to-free-nhs-dental-treatment-in-england/
